It was the first self-propelled torpedo to be widely used by navies around the world. The torpedo was powered by a compressed air engine and could travel at speeds of up to 20 knots (37 km/h). It was equipped with a contact detonation mechanism, which activated when the torpedo struck its target. The Whitehead torpedo marked a turning point in naval strategy, as it allowed ships to attack from a safe distance, reducing the risk to their own crews. Its deployment in the 1870s revolutionized naval combat and set the stage for the development of modern torpedoes. How did the Whitehead torpedo change naval warfare? The Whitehead torpedo fundamentally changed naval warfare by introducing a new level of indirect and long-range combat. gold_ref: A more practical and influential weapon was the self @-@ propelled or Whitehead torpedo. Invented in 1868 and deployed in the 1870s, the Whitehead torpedo formed part of the armament of ironclads of the 1880s like HMS Inflexible and the Italian Caio Duilio and Enrico Dandolo. The ironclad's vulnerability to the torpedo was a key part of the critique of armored warships made by the Jeune Ecole school of naval thought ; it appeared that any ship armored enough to prevent destruction by gunfire would be slow enough to be easily caught by torpedo. In practice, however, the Jeune Ecole was only briefly influential and the torpedo formed part of the confusing mixture of weapons possessed by ironclads.
